page.title: 07LESTWALT PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Lestwalt Primary School was built in 1873 to provide that education required by a rural community of the later 19th C, for pupils from the age of 5 to 14. This it has continued to do, making changes as required by an everchanging society and the educational mores of the day. A two-roomed school with a fine school- house, the building has changed little; an added dining-room and in 1985, an inside toilet block. Increasing numbers required a tin hut extension in the 50's, since demolished. Transfer of 12+ pupils to Stranraer and the present decline in numbers has reduced staff to 2 full-time and 3 part-time and 41 pupils. Technology has, however, crept in and we make full use of computers, videos and other electronic wonders of our age.
